review: I know there are tons of apps that allow you to stream on your TV, but I only wanted to watch movies/TV shows on the TV without having cable or excess wires. I'm sad that this product came out now instead of years ago because I would not have purchased many things (e.g. PS3, cable, xbox) which were all used for streaming media instead of gaming. I like that this product streams in a clear, HD picture. Be warned it is reliant upon your internet speed and will buffer from time to time (just like your phone) if you do not have reliable internet.I hope that this allows Amazon streaming in the future!

author: MichaelAngelo

review: OK, I bought this because I have a Roku 2 that does not have a YouTube channel and Chromecast boasted about casting to TV of YouTube.I used the set up and got connected to my home wifi network.  Netflix works perfectly!  Then I followed directions for casting YouTube and it would not work.I telephoned Google support and once connected to a live person in support located in Michigan I spent nearly 45 minutes discussing the YouTube problem.  I spoke with an ever elevating senior support staff and no one could help me.  We cleared caches, we rebooted the router, we reset the Chromecast device.  Still no YouTube casting.  Google stated that they would resolve this in 24 hours and contact me via email.  That was 3 days ago and still no communication from Google.
author: Stephen Doms

review: It was a little cumbersome to use. Just got it the other day and find myself using my roku3 more. Was locking up and gets stuck when playing youtube content. I was expecting to stream off my android and its not as straight forward. Plus you need a power for the device  off usb. If your tv doesn't have a usb port you have to run a cable to a usb powered adapter (like you would use for a cell phone) For the price is a cheap way to view some content but not as user friendly as I expected. Maybe down the line if they have mirroring and usefull apps like for prime video and stuff it will be a superior item. For now it will prob. sit on the shelf and collect dust with my other pile of electronic fads
